summary: The Belt and Road Oversight Act aims to monitor and counter China's Belt and Road Initiative projects globally. It mandates the Secretary of State to designate Country China Officers in US embassies to report on Chinese activities, including infrastructure investments. The bill requires comprehensive reports on PRC-financed projects, debt obligations, and potential impacts on national sovereignty. It includes annual reporting to Congress and the development of country-specific strategies to counter Chinese influence. The Act also addresses procurement projections and encourages the US International Development Finance Corporation to offer alternative financing for countries targeted by the Belt and Road Initiative.
